CR CR.OPPORTUNITY.PARAMETER CR.OPPORTUNITY.PARAMETER
The opportunity parameter defines high-level rules about handling of opportunities. The principle role of this table is to define the actions that should be done if the system is looking to raise a new opportunity for an existing product, but an existing opportunity through either a campaign or a propensity, and there is already an opportunity stored for that customer for that product. In this case, the actions the system could follow are:
• skip this record (leave the existing opportunity intact) • replace this record (close the existing opportunity, add a new opportunity) • duplicate the opportunity (leave the existing opportunity intact, raise a new opportunity).
However, the decision about whether a new opportunity should skip/replace/duplicate an existing opportunity may depend on the status of the existing opportunity – if an opportunity already exists, has been communicated with the client and they have requested additional documentation, the response from the system may be very different to if the opportunity exists, but has not yet been communicated to the client, or if the opportunity exists, some documentation has been sent to the client but no further response has been forthcoming.
For each different status of the existing opportunity, one of these actions could be chosen for the potential new opportunity.
As a further complication, we may need to define different rules if the new opportunity is generated through a campaign or a propensity (or, for phase 2, an event or even another potential source). Therefore, there will be different rules depending on the source of the new opportunity. In addition to this, the Opportunity Parameter will hold a high-level setting for how long a ‘rejected’ opportunity should cause any new opportunity for the same product to be blocked, and also will hold a setting to determine the maximum number of Outbound Opportunities should be raised for a single customer in a set period, to prevent the same customers from being ‘spammed’ by the bank.

The above field Propensity Overwriting establishes the relationship between an incoming Propensity opportunity for a particular product, and an existing opportunity for that same product. When a match is made (system looking to generate propensity for a product where there is already an opportunity), the status of the existing opportunity is taken into account. This field contains every possible status that a pre-existing opportunity could hold. The next field indicates the action that should be taken when the existing status is present.
